metadata.title: CVE-2015-8962 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Double free vulnerability in the sg_common_write function indrivers/scsi/sg.c in the Linux kernel before 4.4 allows local users to gainprivileges or cause a denial of service (memory corruption and systemcrash) by detaching a device during an SG_IO ioctl call.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8962` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1003.4
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
